private_information: I am capable of picking up and putting down one top block at a time
I can unstack and stack when I hold a block
I observe and report the local state and the actions I execute
manipulator1.goal: Execute assigned block manipulations and report observations and outcomes to the orchestrator

private_information: I am capable of picking up and putting down one top block at a time
I can unstack and stack when I hold a block
I observe and report the local state and the actions I execute
manipulator2.goal: Execute assigned block manipulations and report observations and outcomes to the orchestrator

private_information: I integrate reports from manipulators and produce a consolidated final plan representation
I produce PDDL domain and problem files targeted to the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate observations and the action sequence to produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the final arrangement for FastDownward

public_information: This is a standard BlocksWorld domain where only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time
The blocks involved are A B C D E F G H
Initial arrangement is: A is on the table, B is on A, H is on B, E is on H, G is on the table, F is on G, C is on F, D is on the table
The agents execute the following actions in order: pickup(D), putdown(D), pickup(D), stack(D,E), unstack(C,F), stack(C,D), unstack(C,D), stack(C,F), unstack(C,F), putdown(C)

report.system_prompt: You are a blocks manipulation agent responsible for executing and observing low level block operations. Provide a clear structured report describing which action you executed when asked and the local state changes you observed. Do not emit PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is manipulator1. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->manipulator1->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->manipulator1->goal}. Provide a structured report that lists actions you executed if any, the pre and post state of affected stacks, and any observations relevant for a planner that will later assemble a global PDDL encoding.

report.system_prompt: You are a blocks manipulation agent responsible for executing and observing low level block operations. Provide a clear structured report describing which action you executed when asked and the local state changes you observed. Do not emit PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is manipulator2. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->manipulator2->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->manipulator2->goal}. Provide a structured report that lists actions you executed if any, the pre and post state of affected stacks, and any observations relevant for a planner that will later assemble a global PDDL encoding.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent BlocksWorld PDDL modeling and in generating domain and problem files compatible with the FastDownward planner. You must integrate the manipulators reports and the public information to produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that capture the final arrangement after the described actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the agent actions distinct if relevant and ensure predicates and object names are consistent. Target the FastDownward solver conventions.
pddl.prompt: There are two manipulators that will provide structured reports of executed actions and observations. You will receive their reports. Your goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is the first agent report: {manipulator1.report}. Here is the second agent report: {manipulator2.report}. Integrate the reports, resolve any naming or reference ambiguities, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the final block arrangement resulting from the given action sequence. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the problem uses the objects A B C D E F G H and encodes the final predicates using on and ontable for the final state. The output should be suitable for input to the FastDownward planner.
